clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of L-Citrulline on Vascular Function
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Reduced Arterial Stiffness on Peripheral Vascular Function and Mobility

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this project is to determine the importance of peripheral vascular function on gait performance in older adults.

detailed_description.textblock: This project employed a placebo controlled, double-blind, crossover trial. Participants were randomized to oral L-citrulline (6 g/day) or placebo (maltodextrin) for 14 days, and switched to the other treatment for another 14 days after washout. Peripheral vascular function was assessed under conditions of rest, leg exercise, and cognitive engagement. Gait performance was assessed using clinical walking tests.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 2 weeks for L-citrulline and placebo
primary_outcome.description: Femoral blood flow during leg exercise and carotid blood flow during mental activity measured using Doppler ultrasound. Blood-oxygen-level dependent contrast imaging of the brain using functional magnetic resonance imaging (fMRI) during cognitive functioning.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline and 2 weeks for L-citrulline and placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Usual and fast walking speeds measured during short (7m) and long (400m) distances.

arm_group.description: Subjects allocated to the CitrullinePlacebo study arm received L-citrulline first, followed by placebo.
Subjects allocated to the PlaceboCitrulline study arm received placebo first, followed by L-citrulline.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- older adults
- women and men
- aged 60-79 yrs
- must be able to swallow capsules
- fully mobile without assistive walking devices
Exclusion Criteria:
- have physician diagnosed cardiovascular, pulmonary, or metabolic disease
- are current smokers
- currently taking medications affecting cardiovascular function
- have high blood pressure (>159/99 mmHG)
- have high fasting blood glucose (>110 mg/dL)
- are considered obese (body mass index â‰¥ 30 kg/m2)
- have orthopaedic limitations that limit walking ability
- have pacemaker or other metal objects in their body
